Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility on security grounds for being a member of an organization engaging in terrorism
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Employment with LTTE-controlled company to avoid frontline service
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Avoided frontline service; did not actively support LTTE goals
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Failure to weigh mitigating factors such as lack of commitment to LTTE goals
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible claim of duress and avoidance of combat
Credibility_Factors: Context of forced choices in conflict zone
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Membership includes informal participation or support
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found applicant inadmissible due to alleged LTTE membership
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Federal Court review of administrative decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to properly apply legal test for membership

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work under duress for terrorist-controlled entity
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility based on association with terrorist organization
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether employment under duress constitutes membership in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.34(1)(f)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: IAD failed to assess nature of involvement and intent
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the Minister to establish inadmissibility
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant acted under duress to avoid frontline service
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Membership requires more than mere employment; must involve commitment to organization’s goals
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable determination of terrorist affiliation based solely on employment

Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee claim involving forced association with terrorist group
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Inadmissibility based on alleged LTTE membership despite forced conscription
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and relief from inadmissibility finding
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration and refugee law, international human rights principles
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Assessment of individual’s level of involvement and commitment
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Remanded for redetermination by new panel
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Duress, lack of support for organizational goals
Crimes.Nature_of_Participation: Forced labor to avoid frontline combat
Crimes.Temporal_Context: During active conflict in Sri Lanka
Crimes.Personal_Data_Implicated: Identity, employment history, political affiliation claims
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether individual was a member through free will or under duress
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Failure to assess voluntariness of association
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Membership implies some degree of commitment to objectives
Crimes.State_Protection_Assessment: LTTE operated as non-state actor in absence of state control
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Persecution upon return if deemed collaborator
